body:
RFC offers several choices with one passive:

- Poke
- Increased Burst Frequency
- Range
- Safety

"Every AD builds RFC and Shiv" --Scarra
"Every AD has high movement speed, sustain" --Scarra
"And they get free waveclear" --- Scarra

As an ADC main, I agree. RFC needs changes and building it with shiv every game is so common. Perhaps splitting its passive to a different zeal item would be better but for a class that gets so much peel, help, and sustain - RFC offers quite the variety of options.

I do wish ADCs did have more build diversity than requiring shiv+RFC every game.

Thoughts?

replies.body:
As i said in another post he is well behind the rest of us woth this assesment.

Any botlane player could have told you this last season when they changed cait passive/runnans and the rfc shiv buold became more popular.

Do i agree with what he says, yes but talk about not seeing wood because of the trees
RFC needs to be removed and Bears still shit in public toilets.
Woah, Scarra said that? Well it must be true then.
No - this has been a recurring dilemma stated by the player base. Boards post have frequently targeted the RFC+Shiv combo. Though shiv offers burst, RFC offers that burst at too safe of a range.

most zeal items offer marksmen a bunch of stuff to overly compensate weaknesses in their kits or enhance their already incredibly powerful strengths to an even greater degree.

{{item:3087}} gives burst, magic damage, and waveclear which is something most adcs lack a mixture of for various reasons

{{item:3085}} fundamentally breaks adc's being balanced around single target damage and also adds waveclear

{{item:3094}} as scarra said, gives them more range when range is already _such_ an incredibly powerful stat in the game. they can out poke a lot of mages with this item as they cannot miss their autos and the shiv damage just hurts like hell when coupled with this item. they also heal more with fleet footwork to add insult to injury.

{{item:3046}} hasn't been a huge issue lately due to the other zeal items and a bursty meta but it can feel like a giant middle finger to the champions who need to kill a marksman if they buy this as the adc didn't really have to go out of their way to itemize against them and this item doesn't offer real windows of strong defensive power as other 'offensively defensive' items typically do/should ({{item:3814}} {{item:3139}} {{item:3102}}0
Glad to see he has caught up with the rest of us.
